cz.cvut.agents.rph.reversi.tournament

Class RemoteReversiPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • cz.cvut.agents.rph.reversi.tournament.RemoteReversiPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReversiPlayerInterface, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class RemoteReversiPlayer
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements ReversiPlayerInterface
    Decorates the player to be able to communicate with the tournamentController. Is created as a process by JavaProcess and run remotely using Remote Method Invocation - neat. Author: Ondrej Vanek Date: 10/4/12 Time: 11:09 AM
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • makeNextMove

        public ReversiMove makeNextMove(int[][] board)
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: ReversiPlayerInterface
        makeNextTurn is called by the reversi server when the player has to compute the next move. The method returns a ReversiMove class encapsulating the coordinates of the stone to be put on the board.
        Specified by:
        makeNextMove in interface ReversiPlayerInterface
        Parameters:
        board - - contains actual map of the board represented by two-dimensional matrix. Each sqaure contains number of -1 representing empty square and number 0 and 1 representing players' stones.
        Returns:
        specific reversiMove
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
